head.citation-title: Sampling expansions associated with quaternion difference equations
head.abstracts: © 2022 Informa UK Limited, trading as Taylor & Francis Group.Starting with a quaternion difference equation with boundary conditions, a parameterized sequence that is complete in the finite-dimensional quaternion Hilbert space is derived. By employing the parameterized sequence as the kernel of the discrete transform, we construct a quaternion function space whose elements have sampling expansions. It is shown that the sample points of the sampling expansions are the eigenvalues of an associated quaternion difference operator. For the operator that has multiple standard eigenvalues, we provide a method to find the ‘missing sample points’. Through formulating the boundary-value problems, we make a connection between a class of tridiagonal quaternion matrices and the polynomials with quaternion coefficients. We prove that for a tridiagonal symmetric quaternion matrix, one can always associate a quaternion characteristic polynomial whose roots are the eigenvalues of the matrix. By representing colour image pixels as quaternions, an application of the proposed sampling theorem in colour image encryption is discussed. Throughout the paper, examples are given to illustrate the results.

affiliation.ce:source-text: Department of Mathematics, Faculty of Science and Technology, University of Macau, Macao, People's Republic of China

grant-text.$: This work was supported by Guangdong Basic and Applied Basic Research Foundation (No. 2019A1515111185), Young Innovative Talents Project of Guangdong (No. 2019KQNCX156), University of Macau (MYRG2019-00039-FST), Science and Technology Development Fund, Macao S.A.R (FDCT/0036/2021/AGJ), Natural Science Foundation of Zhejiang Province (No. LY20A010016), National Natural Science Foundation of China (no. 11871379), Natural Science Foundation of Guangdong Province (no. 2021A1515010062). The authors would like to thank the anonymous referees and the editor for their valuable comments and suggestions which improved the quality of this paper.

coredata.dc:description: Starting with a quaternion difference equation with boundary conditions, a parameterized sequence that is complete in the finite-dimensional quaternion Hilbert space is derived. By employing the parameterized sequence as the kernel of the discrete transform, we construct a quaternion function space whose elements have sampling expansions. It is shown that the sample points of the sampling expansions are the eigenvalues of an associated quaternion difference operator. For the operator that has multiple standard eigenvalues, we provide a method to find the ‘missing sample points’. Through formulating the boundary-value problems, we make a connection between a class of tridiagonal quaternion matrices and the polynomials with quaternion coefficients. We prove that for a tridiagonal symmetric quaternion matrix, one can always associate a quaternion characteristic polynomial whose roots are the eigenvalues of the matrix. By representing colour image pixels as quaternions, an application of the proposed sampling theorem in colour image encryption is discussed. Throughout the paper, examples are given to illustrate the results.
coredata.dc:title: Sampling expansions associated with quaternion difference equations
